text: The order Anseriformes contains about 150 living species of birds in four families: the Anhimidae (the screamers), Anseranatidae (the Magpie goose), the Anatidae, which includes over 140 species of waterfowl, among them the ducks, geese, and swans and the â€ Vegavidae, containing the sole genus Vegavis. All species in the order are highly adapted to live at the water surface. All are web-footed for good swimming. While most live on water, some live mainly on land. Category:Anseriformes
title: Anseriformes
